First we load the .xls file.
the gdata package is required for this.
Our Excel has some header text on the top, so we add pattern = "BOROUGH" to start at the first relevant row.

```{r loadmanhattanfile, echo=TRUE}
require(gdata)
MH1 <- read.xls("rollingsales_manhattan.xls", pattern = "BOROUGH")
```

a Quick summary of the data:

```{r head}
head(MH1)
summary(MH1)
str(MH1)
```

Most data is stored in factors, let's convert these in more meaningfull types:

```{r cleaning}
MH1$SALE.PRICE <- as.numeric(MH1$SALE.PRICE)
MH1$SALE.DATE <- as.Date(MH1$SALE.DATE)
MH1$LAND.SQUARE.FEET <- as.numeric(MH1$LAND.SQUARE.FEET)
MH1$GROSS.SQUARE.FEET <- as.numeric(MH1$GROSS.SQUARE.FEET)
MH1$RESIDENTIAL.UNITS <- as.integer(MH1$RESIDENTIAL.UNITS)
MH1$TOTAL.UNITS <- as.integer(MH1$TOTAL.UNITS)
```
